title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
ARTIST: Julia Wolf
- SONGS: Captions, Chlorine, Girls In Purgatory, High Waist Jeans, Hoops,  Immortale, In My Way, Pillow, Play it Safe, Styrofoam Cup, Villian.

ARTIST: Sleeping At Last
- SONGS: Arctic, From The Ground U, Hearing, Her Joy Was Complete, I'll Keep You Safe, Levels Of Light, Mercury, Light, Saturn, Snow, Watermark.

ARTIST: Koda
- SONGS: Angel, Hands, Staying (Guitar Cover By Vincent Charbonnier), The Warmth, Weightless.

My three recos for the thread:

* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L4IfpTYf6ME](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L4IfpTYf6ME)  
Yamaguchi by Amaia. Beautiful Spanish music, wish I knew what the lyrics meant!
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iC47rfCoIxs](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iC47rfCoIxs)  
Other Side of Goodbye by Matt Andersen. A blues song, the guy has a powerful voice.
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HdlZwGiKqNQ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HdlZwGiKqNQ)  
Tonight belongs to you by Bissett. Banger from an up-and-coming Irish DJ.

I watched a podcast from Biswa and KV, and they talked in detail about AR Rahman songs. So decided to go through more of AR Rahman's early discography and well, it is just diamonds and gold one after another.
Watch that documentary called Jai Ho on A R Rahman.  Its available on YouTube
